item.title: Docker Tips and Tricks
item.description: Manage container /etc/hosts See section Managing /etc/hosts Example: $ docker run -it --add-host db-static:86.75.30.9 ubuntu cat /etc/hosts 127.0.0.1 localhost ::1 localhost ip6-localhost ip6-loopback fe00::0 ip6-localnet ff00::0 ip6-mcastprefix ff02::1 ip6-allnodes ff02::2 ip6-allrouters 86.75.30.9 db-static 172.17.0.2 f0ab12b0b544 Connect offline docker container to network If you used weave, sometimes you may face to such errors: Sep 27 16:36:04 server01 docker[21483]: Error response from daemon: network 5d003f4577873af43afbcead7cd1496bbcccb3473465dd01ccee8ef3b49a0045 not found this means that weave was upgraded and changed its network ID, for resolving this issue you may instead of re-created every container, just connect the container to the new weave network.

item.title: Docker User Defined Networks
item.description: Problem Docker use DHCP by default so your containers may changed their IP addresses adfter reboot, in fact, in old docker version it was after every reboot. It’s very annoying. Of course you can use docker-compose which will manage these things and links between containers will not be broken, but if you do not want to use docker-compose this may come a big problem. Solution Use the user defined networks.
